a.n: Je Me Souviens, 100 Ans Du Royal 22e RÃ©giment

p.d: 1914, during the turmoil of the First World War, the Canadian government authorises the formation of the only French-speaking battalion to participate in the Great War: the Royal 22nd Regiment. Includes soldiers' letters and stories, with archive footage. Claude Guilmain explores a little-known aspect of military history. Directed by: Claude Guilmain (Canada, 2014)
